summary.risk_level: CRITICAL RISK - Severe security flaws present. Do NOT deploy without remediation.

findings.title: Hardcoded Secret
findings.description: Potential hardcoded credential or secret detected on line 12.
findings.recommendation: Use environment variables or a secrets manager (e.g., HashiCorp Vault, AWS Secrets Manager) instead of hardcoding secrets.

findings.title: Hardcoded Secret
findings.description: Potential hardcoded credential or secret detected on line 13.
findings.recommendation: Use environment variables or a secrets manager (e.g., HashiCorp Vault, AWS Secrets Manager) instead of hardcoding secrets.

findings.title: Exposed API Key
findings.description: Potential hardcoded credential or secret detected on line 13.
findings.recommendation: Use environment variables or a secrets manager (e.g., HashiCorp Vault, AWS Secrets Manager) instead of hardcoding secrets.

findings.title: Use of eval() Detected
findings.description: eval() on line 79 can execute arbitrary code if user input is passed.
findings.recommendation: Avoid eval() entirely. Use safe alternatives like ast.literal_eval() for data parsing, or redesign the logic.

findings.title: SQL Injection Risk - String Concatenation in Query
findings.description: Line 42 appears to build a SQL query via string concatenation or f-string, which is vulnerable to SQL injection.
findings.code_snippet: query = "SELECT * FROM users WHERE username = '" + username + "' AND password = '" + password + "'"
findings.recommendation: Use parameterized queries or an ORM (e.g., SQLAlchemy). Never concatenate user input directly into SQL.

findings.title: SQL Injection Risk - String Concatenation in Query
findings.description: Line 69 appears to build a SQL query via string concatenation or f-string, which is vulnerable to SQL injection.
findings.code_snippet: query = f"SELECT * FROM products WHERE name LIKE '%{term}%'"
findings.recommendation: Use parameterized queries or an ORM (e.g., SQLAlchemy). Never concatenate user input directly into SQL.

findings.title: SQL Injection Risk - String Concatenation in Query
findings.description: Line 91 appears to build a SQL query via string concatenation or f-string, which is vulnerable to SQL injection.
findings.code_snippet: cursor.execute("UPDATE users SET password = '" + new_pass + "' WHERE id = " + user_id)
findings.recommendation: Use parameterized queries or an ORM (e.g., SQLAlchemy). Never concatenate user input directly into SQL.

findings.title: Debug Mode Enabled
findings.description: Debug mode is enabled on line 16. In production, this exposes stack traces, internal state, and may enable the interactive debugger.
findings.recommendation: Disable debug mode in production. Use environment-based configuration (e.g., DEBUG = os.getenv('DEBUG', 'False') == 'True').

findings.title: Debug Mode Enabled
findings.description: Debug mode is enabled on line 17. In production, this exposes stack traces, internal state, and may enable the interactive debugger.
findings.recommendation: Disable debug mode in production. Use environment-based configuration (e.g., DEBUG = os.getenv('DEBUG', 'False') == 'True').

findings.title: Plaintext Password Comparison
findings.description: Line 35 compares a password in plaintext. Passwords should be hashed before storage and comparison.
findings.code_snippet: if username == ADMIN_USER and password == ADMIN_PASS:
findings.recommendation: Use bcrypt, argon2, or PBKDF2 for password hashing. Never store or compare plaintext passwords.

findings.title: Unauthenticated Route Handler
findings.description: Route 'login' does not verify authentication.
findings.code_snippet:
def login():
    username = request.form.get("username")
    password = request.form.get("password")

    # Vulnerability: Plaintext password comparison
    if username == ADMIN_USER and password == A
findings.recommendation: Add authentication checks.

findings.title: Login Bypass - Always-True Condition
findings.description: Function 'admin_panel' contains 'or True' which bypasses authentication.
findings.recommendation: Remove always-true conditions.

findings.title: Unauthenticated Route Handler
findings.description: Route 'search' does not verify authentication.
findings.code_snippet:

    term = request.args.get("q", "")
    db = get_db()
    cursor = db.cursor()

    # Vulnerability: Another raw SQL injection
    query = f"SELECT * FROM products WHERE name LIKE '%{te
findings.recommendation: Add authentication checks.

findings.title: Unauthenticated Route Handler
findings.description: Route 'eval_endpoint' does not verify authentication.
findings.recommendation: Add authentication checks.

findings.title: Unauthenticated Route Handler
findings.description: Route 'reset_password' does not verify authentication.
findings.code_snippet:
def reset_password():
    user_id = request.form.get("user_id")
    new_pass = request.form.get("password")
    db = get_db()
    cursor = db.cursor()

    # Vulnerability: SQL injection in update
findings.recommendation: Add authentication checks.

findings.title: Unsanitized User Input Reaches eval()
findings.description: In function 'eval_endpoint', user-controlled variable(s) ['data'] flow directly into 'eval()' without apparent sanitization.
findings.recommendation: Sanitize and validate all user-supplied data before passing to database queries, OS commands, or eval-like functions. Use parameterized queries for SQL.

findings.title: Unsanitized User Input Reaches cursor.execute()
findings.description: In function 'reset_password', user-controlled variable(s) ['new_pass', 'user_id'] flow directly into 'cursor.execute()' without apparent sanitization.
findings.code_snippet: cursor.execute("UPDATE users SET password = '" + new_pass + "' WHERE id = " + user_id)
findings.recommendation: Sanitize and validate all user-supplied data before passing to database queries, OS commands, or eval-like functions. Use parameterized queries for SQL.

findings.title: Vulnerable Dependency: flask
findings.description: flask==0.12.3 may be affected by CVE-2018-1000656: Flask before 0.12.5 is vulnerable to Denial of Service via malicious JSON data.
findings.recommendation: Upgrade flask to the latest patched version. Run: pip install --upgrade flask

findings.title: Vulnerable Dependency: django
findings.description: django==2.2.0 may be affected by CVE-2022-28346: Django SQL injection vulnerability in QuerySet.annotate().
findings.recommendation: Upgrade django to the latest patched version. Run: pip install --upgrade django

findings.title: Vulnerable Dependency: requests
findings.description: requests==2.18.0 may be affected by CVE-2018-18074: Requests library sends HTTP Authorization header to redirected hosts.
findings.recommendation: Upgrade requests to the latest patched version. Run: pip install --upgrade requests

findings.title: Vulnerable Dependency: pillow
findings.description: pillow==8.0.0 may be affected by CVE-2022-22817: Pillow PIL.ImageMath.eval allows arbitrary code execution.
findings.recommendation: Upgrade pillow to the latest patched version. Run: pip install --upgrade pillow

findings.title: Vulnerable Dependency: pyyaml
findings.description: pyyaml==5.3 may be affected by CVE-2020-14343: PyYAML arbitrary code execution via yaml.load() without Loader.
findings.recommendation: Upgrade pyyaml to the latest patched version. Run: pip install --upgrade pyyaml

findings.title: Vulnerable Dependency: sqlalchemy
findings.description: sqlalchemy==1.3.0 may be affected by CVE-2019-7164: SQLAlchemy SQL injection via order_by() parameter.
findings.recommendation: Upgrade sqlalchemy to the latest patched version. Run: pip install --upgrade sqlalchemy

findings.title: Vulnerable Dependency: jinja2
findings.description: jinja2==2.10.0 may be affected by CVE-2020-28493: Jinja2 ReDoS vulnerability in urlize filter.
findings.recommendation: Upgrade jinja2 to the latest patched version. Run: pip install --upgrade jinja2

findings.title: Vulnerable Dependency: werkzeug
findings.description: werkzeug==1.0.0 may be affected by CVE-2023-25577: Werkzeug multipart data parsing DoS vulnerability.
findings.recommendation: Upgrade werkzeug to the latest patched version. Run: pip install --upgrade werkzeug

findings.title: Vulnerable Dependency: numpy
findings.description: numpy may be affected by CVE-2019-6446: NumPy pickle deserialization vulnerability via np.load().
findings.recommendation: Upgrade numpy to the latest patched version. Run: pip install --upgrade numpy

findings.title: Unpinned Dependency: numpy
findings.description: numpy has no version pinned. Unpinned dependencies can introduce breaking changes or vulnerabilities automatically.
findings.recommendation: Pin to a specific version: numpy==<version>. Use 'pip freeze' to get current versions.

findings.title: Vulnerable Dependency: urllib3
findings.description: urllib3==1.25.0 may be affected by CVE-2021-33503: urllib3 ReDoS vulnerability in URL parsing.
findings.recommendation: Upgrade urllib3 to the latest patched version. Run: pip install --upgrade urllib3

findings.title: PostgreSQL Connection String with Credentials in Git History
findings.description: A potential secret was found in commit b1cd13ae (2026-02-24) by BM840. Even if deleted from current code, this secret remains accessible in git history to anyone with repo access.
findings.recommendation:
1. Rotate/revoke the exposed secret immediately.
2. Use 'git filter-repo' or BFG Repo Cleaner to purge from history.
3. Force-push the cleaned history.
4. Use environment variables for all secrets going forward.
